node.title: Underwhelming uptake for Kāinga Ora First Home scheme
node.description: Kāinga Ora is positive about its First Home Partner scheme, despite taking more than four months for a single property to be settled.

node.title: Gun clubs worry Arms Act changes will misfire for hobby shooters
node.description: Gun clubs warn some will fold as a result of regulations arising from the Christchurch terror attacks, forcing hunters and shooters to blaze away in the back blocks instead of ranges.

node.title: More people biking in Christchurch than in any other New Zealand city
node.description: More Christchurch locals are getting on their bikes with one cycling advocate saying its boost in popularity is down to investment in cycleways after the 2011 earthquakes.

node.title: National Geographic photo prints for sale, with proceeds going to Ukraine relief
node.description: The women-owned nonprofit Vital Impacts is partnering with National Geographic photographers to raise money for Direct Relief.

node.title: IRD says high income earners may be trying to avoid new tax bracket
node.description: The tax department thinks some high income earners may be trying to avoid the new top tax bracket, with officials concerned that people are shifting money around to avoid paying.

node.title: Miami Bitcoin 2022 expo draws crypto-crazed to growing tech hub
node.description: Thousands of crypto enthusiasts are gathering in Miami, now tied with Los Angeles in funding raised by blockchain startups.

node.title: Pentagon training a small number of Ukrainians in the U.S. on new weapons

node.title: People with lingering Covid-19 symptoms struggling with brain fog, returning to work

node.title: 'We have no idea of the real numbers' - Memo highlights fear RAT tests unrecorded
node.description: A leading epidemiologist says we have no idea how many community cases of Covid-19 there are in New Zealand because so many people aren't recording their rapid antigen test results.

node.title: FDA warns of raw oysters potentially contaminated with norovirus
node.description: Health officials are working to curtail outbreak that has sickened at least 91 people in 13 states and 279 Canadians.

node.title: Mortgage rates top 5% — and loan applications take a hit
node.description: The average 30-year home loan rate hasn't topped 5% in more than a decade, according to Freddie Mac data.

node.title: Russian and Belarusian athletes banned from 2022 Boston Marathon
node.description: The BAA announced that anyone currently residing in either Russia or Belarus will not be able to compete in the Boston Marathon or BAA 5K.

node.title: Nothing off table with future sanctions against Russia - US official
node.description: The US State Department's John Armstrong says after a career working in the region it is truly painful to see what has happened to Ukraine. He told Checkpoint it will not be a short conflict. Audio

node.title: Property market slowdown: Some may 'come unstuck'

node.title: Airlines cancel flights due to COVID-19 after dropping mask rules

node.title: Republicans target Disney's copyrights over opposition of bill

node.title: Fox euthanized after allegedly biting 9 people on Capitol Hill
node.description: A congressman and a reporter are among those who said they were bitten while walking on Capitol grounds.

node.title: Texas election officials rejected one out of eight mail ballots cast in primary

node.title: USPS says it wants to raise postage rates — again

node.title: Dairy returns help drive fourth month of record highs for commodity exports

node.title: Sri Lanka's president defies calls for his resignation
